uk.ac.qmul.sbcs.evolution.convergence

Class StateComparison

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.qmul.sbcs.evolution.convergence.StateComparison

  • public class StateComparison
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class to perform comparisons betwen ancestral state reconstructions and terminal tips.

    Assumes the reconstructions themselves have already been performed on a TreeNode with a ParsimonyReconstruction.

    This class likely called by a ParallelSubstitutionDetector

    States (of nucleotides, amino acids or other discrete data) are represented as an array of HashSets - it is presumed that in the case of sequence data this array will therefore comprise one HashSet per aligned sequence position.

    Author:
    Joe Parker, Kitson Consulting / Queen Mary University of London
    See Also:
    TreeNode, ParsimonyReconstruction, ParallelSubstitutionDetector, ParallelSubstitutionDetectorMRCA

      • countParallelChanges

        public int countParallelChanges()

      • printStateComparisonBetweenTwoNodes

        public static java.lang.Integer[] printStateComparisonBetweenTwoNodes(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>[] nodeStatesOne,
                                                                      java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>[] nodeStatesTwo,
                                                                      java.lang.String nodeLabelOne,
                                                                      java.lang.String nodeLabelTwo)
        This is a static utility method to print a comparison between two sets of states (implied to be from nodeOne and nodeTwo).

        NOTE: it is assumed

        Parameters:
        nodeStatesOne - - States of first node (e.g. [{A},{C},{C},{T}... n])
        nodeStatesTwo - - States of second node
        nodeLabelOne - - Label of first node (e.g. name)
        nodeLabelTwo - - Label of second node
        Returns:
        divergentStatePositions - array of positions (indexed to 1, not 0) of divergent states (positions/NTs/AAs) between nodeOne and nodeTwo. Calling divergentStatePositions.length will therefore give the count of substitutions (not including 'X' or '-' characters).

        *Indexed from (1..length) not (0..(length-1)) as this the convention when indexing sequence alignment positions
